Letters of Antigonos I concerning the synoicism of Teos and Lebedos

Grain merchants instructed to bring grain to the agora, to pay taxes on it, even if they wish to move to a different city if they see the prices are not favourable; likewise, farmers who wish to export their produce must first declare them to the agoranomos, and pay the taxes due, before exporting them.
Letters of Antigonos I concerning the synoicism of Teos and Lebedos

Letters of Antigonos I concerning the synoicism of Teos and Lebedos

Seeing that the Lebedians' normal taxes are insuffient for paying for the new houses, Antigonos asks that the wealthy class be expanded to 600 individuals, who are to furnish a fourth of the cost straight up.
